definition: to take the car, bus, train etc
to sit/to take a seat/to take (a bus, airplane etc)/to bear fruit/variant of 座[zuo4]
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: I simply don’t want to go without a vehicle.
On wheels or on foot, everyone was rushing.
sentences.chinese: 不管坐車還是步行，人人都來去匆匆。

sentences.english: I can't stand the smell of petrol and always become dizzy in a car.
sentences.chinese: 我受不了汽油味，每次坐車都覺得頭暈。

sentences.english: The nearest hospital is an hour away by car.
sentences.chinese: 離村子最近的醫院，坐車需要一小時。

sentences.english: DOGGET runs outside as the rest of his task force arrives by car.
sentences.chinese: 當特遣部隊坐車到達的時候，道吉特跑了出去。

sentences.english: His latest novel came to him while sitting in traffic in Tokyo.
sentences.chinese: 他最新的小說是在坐車時突發奇想，靈光閃現。

sentences.english: After about two hours, we went back to the Old City.
sentences.chinese: 在拉市海逗留了大概2個小時，又坐車返回麗江古城。

sentences.english: We're going to Hong Kong by car for a day trip.
sentences.chinese: 我們要坐車去香港旅遊一天。

sentences.english: It is one hour' ride from Shanghai to Suzhou.
sentences.chinese: 從上海坐車到蘇州有1小時的路程。

sentences.english: Emergency car left the site, only to enjoy the car window Xianxin scene.
sentences.chinese: 有事坐車離開工地，纔有閒心欣賞車窗外的景緻。

sentences.english: It is one hour' ride from Shanyghai to Suzhou.
sentences.chinese: 從上海坐車到蘇州有1小時的旅程。

sentences.english: My mother would rather walk than take a car because of carsick.
sentences.chinese: 我媽媽寧可步行也不願坐車，因爲她暈車。

sentences.english: We can go there by bus.
Then I will go to pick you up at the airport. I will drive you to my home.
sentences.chinese: 到時候我會去機場接你，然後再坐車到我家。

sentences.english: my freshman and sophomore years from Hollywood.
sentences.chinese: 大一大二的時候從好萊塢坐車上學。

sentences.english: We’ll get there quicker by car.
sentences.chinese: 坐車去我們將快點到達那裏。

definition: to take a taxi (in town)/to hitch a lift
to transfer/to change trains, buses etc
to ride (in a vehicle)/to get a lift/to hitch-hike
travel time/expected time for a car journey
to go to school/to attend school
bus/abbr. for 公共汽車|公共汽车[gong1 gong4 qi4 che1]/car belonging to an organization and used by its members (government car, police car, company car etc)/abbr. for 公務用車|公务用车[gong1 wu4 yong4 che1]
to get off or out of (a bus, train, car etc)
to set off/to start (on a journey)
